comment: Definition of representative muscle points within the worm's mesh (3D model)
The muscle points are defined by indices to the mesh points
A list of indices, defining for each muscle two points out of the muscle's initial ring, are defined. The midpoint of those considered two points is the centre of the initial ring of the muscle.
The data is grouped in octants and correspond to   octant 0=DMR,      1=DLR,     2=VLR,     3=VMR,     4=VML,     5=VLL,     6=DLL,     7=DML
Octants start at      10 o'clock, 11 o'clock, 1 o'clock, 2 o'clock, 4 o'clock, 5 o'clock, 7 o'clock, 8 o'clock
the number of muscles defined for each octant is:  DMR (12), DLR (12), VLR (12), VMR (12), VML (12), VLL (11), DLL (12), DML (12)
Format: <muscle octant ID>: [ <muscle 0 point1 index>, <muscle 0 point2 index>, <muscle 1 point1 index>, <muscle 1 point2 index>,... ]
